metadata.title: SF DBI Electronic Plan Review (EPR) Requirements
metadata.source: SF DBI EPR Guidelines (Exhibit F) + Bluebeam Usage Guide
metadata.context: DBI transitioned to 100% Electronic Plan Review for In-House Review projects. All plans reviewed in Bluebeam. Non-compliant submissions will be delayed or rejected.

epr_mandate.regulatory_basis: Administrative Bulletin AB-004, Section on Concurrent Review
epr_mandate.quote: The applicant of a priority project shall be required to submit plans for electronic plan review (EPR) to avail of concurrent plan review.
epr_mandate.current_status: As of January 1, 2024, ALL plan submissions to DBI must be electronic — EPR is no longer limited to priority projects

submission_platform.name: Bluebeam Studio
submission_platform.note: All in-house review plans are reviewed in Bluebeam Studio sessions

drawing_production.detail: Plan drawings created in CAD programs must use vector-based lines. Must line up when overlaid electronically. Scanned/raster drawings are not acceptable for plan review.
drawing_production.common_violation: Architects scanning hand-drawn markups instead of CAD output

drawing_production.detail: Use TrueType or OpenType fonts to create searchable text within the document. SHX fonts (AutoCAD default) are allowed only if you run batch OCR on the drawing set with Bluebeam eXtreme afterward.
drawing_production.common_violation: AutoCAD SHX fonts creating non-searchable text — plan checkers can't search for code references

drawing_production.detail: All drawing sheets must be in one consolidated PDF file per document type. Do not submit individual sheet PDFs.
drawing_production.common_violation: Submitting separate PDFs for each sheet

drawing_production.detail: Plot or print drawing sheets at full 1:1 scale from authoring software. Also called 100% or 'to scale' output. Do NOT use 'scale to fit' printing.
drawing_production.common_violation: Printing to letter-size PDF instead of arch-size — makes dimensions unreadable in Bluebeam

drawing_production.detail: Drawing sheets must be at least 22" x 34" (ANSI D or Arch D). Larger sheets accepted. Exception: signage permits accept 11" x 17". Supplemental forms/documents at 8.5" x 11".
drawing_production.common_violation: Entire set printed at 11x17 — too small for plan review markup

drawing_production.detail: Each uploaded file must be less than 250MB. For site permit addenda, limit is 350MB.
drawing_production.common_violation: High-resolution raster images embedded in plan set inflating file size

pdf_metadata_and_navigation.rule: Bookmarks with page number and sheet name
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.detail: Add bookmarks for each sheet with format: 'A0.0 - COVER SHEET'. Calculations do not need bookmarks. DBI says 'We do not require bookmarks' but 'Reviewers can work faster if you add them.'
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.common_violation: No bookmarks — plan checkers have to scroll through 50+ pages manually

pdf_metadata_and_navigation.detail: Drawings shall have page labels in the Thumbnail tab containing sheet number and name. Labels must match bookmark labels.
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.common_violation: Default numeric page labels instead of sheet numbers

pdf_metadata_and_navigation.rule: PDF must be unlocked and editable
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.detail: Do not submit locked, password-protected, encrypted, or 'restricted' documents. Bluebeam needs to add markup, comments, and stamps.
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.common_violation: PDF exported with security restrictions from Adobe Acrobat

pdf_metadata_and_navigation.detail: Do not use certificate-type digital signatures. This will lock the file and delay permit approval. Use scanned graphic signatures instead.
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.common_violation: Engineer using Adobe Sign or DocuSign certificate signature — locks the PDF for Bluebeam

cover_sheet.rule: Total page count on cover sheet
cover_sheet.detail: Cover sheets must have a total page count that matches the actual PDF page count.
cover_sheet.common_violation: Cover says '12 sheets' but PDF has 14 pages

cover_sheet.rule: 8.5" x 11" blank area on cover sheet
cover_sheet.detail: Cover sheets must contain a blank area that is 8.5" wide x 11" tall for DBI stamping and permit information.
cover_sheet.common_violation: Cover sheet completely filled with project info — no room for DBI permit stamp

title_block.detail: Title blocks must have the project address on every sheet in the entire set.
title_block.common_violation: Address on cover but missing from individual drawing sheets

title_block.detail: Title blocks must have the sheet number on every sheet.
title_block.common_violation: Unnumbered supplemental pages mixed into drawing set

title_block.detail: Title blocks must have the sheet name (description) on every sheet.
title_block.common_violation: Sheet numbers present but no descriptive names

title_block.rule: 2" x 2" blank area on every sheet title block
title_block.detail: A blank area at least 2" wide x 2" tall must appear in the same location on every sheet's title block. Used for reviewer stamps and approval marks.
title_block.common_violation: Title block completely filled — reviewer has to stamp over existing content

title_block.detail: Title blocks must have 3 consistent items on every sheet in the entire set (typically: project address, firm name/logo, and sheet numbering format).
title_block.common_violation: Mixed title block formats when structural engineer uses different template than architect

signatures_and_stamps.rule: Design professional signature and stamp on every sheet
signatures_and_stamps.detail: Every sheet must have your signature and stamp. Use a scanned graphic signature with a PDF stamp. Scan a .PNG file with transparent background for best results.
signatures_and_stamps.common_violation: Unsigned sheets — especially supplemental calculation pages

signatures_and_stamps.rule: Flatten PDF after adding graphic signatures
signatures_and_stamps.detail: If you add a graphic stamp or signature after creating the PDF, flatten the PDF to embed the images. Unflattened stamps can be moved or deleted in Bluebeam.
signatures_and_stamps.common_violation: Stamp added as Bluebeam annotation instead of flattened into page

file_naming.detail: Format: [Number Prefix]-[Document type]-[Revision Number] [Street address]_[Type/Count of Addenda]. If no application number yet, use street address. 6 accepted document types with number prefixes.
file_naming.common_violation: Files named 'plans_final_v3.pdf' instead of following convention

bluebeam_specific.detail: You must add DBI's Back Check page PDF to submit plans in Bluebeam. This is a standardized page for tracking review comments and responses.
bluebeam_specific.common_violation: Forgetting to append the back check page template

bluebeam_specific.rule: Dense hatching may cause rendering issues
bluebeam_specific.detail: Not an official DBI rule, but dense cross-hatching patterns cause slow rendering and lag in Bluebeam Studio sessions. Plan checkers may request simplified hatching.
bluebeam_specific.common_violation: Dense material hatching patterns causing Bluebeam to freeze during markup

exhibit_f_supplementary.source: EPR Exhibit F — PDF Creation Guidelines (original source document for EPR-001 through EPR-022)

bookmark_hierarchy.description: Recommended bookmark structure for plan sets. Not strictly required but significantly speeds review.
bookmark_hierarchy.format: Sheet Number - Sheet Name (e.g., 'A1.0 - FLOOR PLAN')
bookmark_hierarchy.note: Bookmarks help plan checkers navigate directly to specific sheets. DBI reviews 500+ plan sets per month — fast navigation = faster review.

sheet_numbering_convention.description: Standard discipline-based sheet numbering used by DBI reviewers. Consistent numbering across all projects helps reviewers find information quickly.

file_size_guidance.recommended_split: Split plan sets at 50MB for faster upload and download
common_causes_of_large_files: High-resolution raster images embedded in drawings
Embedded 3D model data from Revit exports
Dense hatching patterns rendered as raster
reduction_tips: Downsample images to 150-200 DPI (sufficient for plan review)
Remove embedded 3D model data before PDF export
Use vector hatching instead of raster patterns
Run PDF optimizer in Bluebeam or Acrobat before upload

must_not_have: Password protection (open password or permissions password)
DocuSign or Adobe Sign certificate signatures (locks PDF)
must_allow: Page extraction and reordering by reviewers
Stamp placement by DBI for approval
pdf_security_requirements.note: Plan checkers cannot review locked PDFs in Bluebeam. A locked submission will be returned without review.

batch_ocr_instructions.context: AutoCAD SHX fonts create non-searchable text in PDF. Plan checkers need to search for code references (e.g., 'CBC 11B', 'NFPA 13').
steps: Open plan set in Bluebeam Revu
Go to Document > OCR > Run OCR on entire document
Save and verify text is searchable by using Ctrl+F
batch_ocr_instructions.alternative: Use TrueType or OpenType fonts in AutoCAD (set TEXTFONT system variable) to avoid needing OCR entirely

back_check_page.source: DBI EPR Back Check Page PDF (Updated 01/19/2021)
back_check_page.description: A standardized Bluebeam-formatted page that must be appended as the LAST page of every plan set PDF. Contains the backcheck menu that DBI plan reviewers need to complete plan review.
instructions: Export a PDF file of your plans
Add the Back Check Page as the last page of the PDF file
back_check_page.format: Bluebeam-formatted PDF — contains embedded Bluebeam form fields for reviewer use
back_check_page.common_mistake: Forgetting to add this page, or adding it in the middle of the plan set instead of at the end

exhibit_c_project_folder_structure.source: CCSF EPR Exhibit C — Bluebeam Studio Project Layout & Folder Structure (2/10/2020)
exhibit_c_project_folder_structure.description: Defines the standard folder structure within Bluebeam Studio Projects used for DBI electronic plan review. Understanding this structure helps applicants know where their documents will be organized.
exhibit_c_project_folder_structure.project_naming: Format: [Year]-[Application Number] [Street Address] (e.g., '2019-1126-1234 49 S. Van Ness')

subfolders.name: 2. ROUTING FORMS
subfolders.contents: Agency routing forms for Planning, DPH, SFFD, etc.

subfolders.name: 3. DOCUMENTS FOR REVIEW
subfolders.contents: Plan sets, calculations, reports — the actual construction documents for review

subfolders.name: 1. BUILDING PERMIT DOCUMENTS
subfolders.contents: Final approved and stamped plan sets after all agencies approve

exhibit_c_project_folder_structure.applicant_note: Applicants upload to folder A. DBI moves approved documents to folder B after permit issuance.

exhibit_e_studio_session_layout.source: CCSF EPR Exhibit E — Bluebeam Studio Session Layout (2/10/2020)
exhibit_e_studio_session_layout.description: Visual reference for how Bluebeam Studio Sessions are configured for DBI plan review. Sessions are where real-time multi-agency review and markup happens.
exhibit_e_studio_session_layout.session_naming: Format: [Application Number] [Street Address] REVIEW - [Session Number] (e.g., '2019-1126-1234 49 S. Van Ness REVIEW - 95')

session_components.studio_menu: Studio tab must be selected (not Projects) to access the active review session
session_components.studio_connection: Green cloud icon indicates connected to Studio — required for real-time collaboration
session_components.attendees_panel: Shows all reviewers currently in the session (DBI BLDG, DBI MECH, FIRE, etc.) with online/offline status
session_components.documents_panel: Shows the plan set PDF(s) uploaded to the session
session_components.bookmarks_panel: Pull up from bottom — shows sheet navigation bookmarks (why EPR-007 bookmark format matters)
session_components.tool_chest: DBI-specific markup tools: Callout, Text Box, Cloud+, Dimensional Note, Highlighter, Length Measurement, Area Measurement
session_components.markups_list: Bottom panel showing all review comments with Date, Page Label, Author, Color, Comments, and Status columns

markup_status_workflow.description: When a reviewer adds a correction comment, applicant must respond using the status menu (double-click to respond)

applicant_response_statuses.meaning: Applicant has addressed the comment and made the correction in revised plans
Applicant has not made the change — must include explanation in reply

reviewer_back_check_statuses.meaning: Reviewer has verified the correction was properly made — comment is resolved
Reviewer has NOT accepted the response — correction still needed or response inadequate

markup_status_workflow.workflow_sequence: Reviewer comments → Applicant responds (INCORPORATED/NOT INCORPORATED) → Reviewer back-checks (CLOSED/OPEN) → Repeat until all CLOSED

exhibit_e_studio_session_layout.color_coding_note: Different agencies use different markup colors to distinguish their comments. DBI BLDG, DBI MECH, FIRE, and other reviewers each have assigned colors visible in the Markups List.

severity_levels.reject: DBI will not process the submission. Must fix before filing.
severity_levels.warning: DBI may accept but will likely issue a correction letter. Fix to avoid delays.
severity_levels.recommendation: Not required but significantly improves review speed and reduces friction.

pre_submission_checks: All sheets in single consolidated PDF [EPR-003]
Minimum sheet size 22" x 34" for drawings [EPR-005]
PDF unlocked — no encryption or passwords [EPR-009]
8.5" x 11" blank area on cover sheet [EPR-012]
Design professional signature/stamp on every sheet [EPR-018]
Flatten PDF after adding graphic signatures [EPR-019]

format_requirements.confidence: high — sourced from official DBI EPR Guidelines (Exhibit F)

requirements.details: CAD-produced vector lines, not scanned images. Non-compliant = rejection.
Searchable text required. SHX fonts need OCR post-processing.
One PDF per document type. No individual sheet files.
Print at 100% scale from authoring software.
ANSI D or Arch D minimum. Signage permits: 11x17. Supplements: 8.5x11.
Per upload. Site permit addenda: 350MB limit.
No encryption, passwords, or security restrictions.
Use scanned graphic signatures. DocuSign/Adobe Sign certificates lock the PDF.
DBI standardized Back Check page appended to plan set.

cover_sheet: Project scope description matching permit application
Code references (Building Code edition, Fire Code, Accessibility)
Total page count matching actual PDF pages [EPR-011]
8.5" x 11" blank area for DBI stamping [EPR-012]
title_block_every_sheet: 2" x 2" blank area for reviewer stamps [EPR-016]
architectural_plans: Sections showing existing and proposed conditions

submission_copies.otc_review: Submit via PermitSF portal — electronic only as of Jan 2024
submission_copies.in_house_review: Submit via PermitSF portal for electronic plan review in Bluebeam
submission_copies.note: Physical paper plans are no longer accepted for initial submission

correction_response_workflow.source: CCSF EPR Applicant Procedure Guide (2024), pages 21-49
correction_response_workflow.overview: When plan checkers identify issues during review, they add Bluebeam markup comments directly on the plans. The applicant must respond to ALL comments before resubmittal.

steps.step: Download marked-up plans from Bluebeam Studio session
steps.detail: Plan checker comments appear as Bluebeam markup annotations on specific sheets. Download the full annotated set to review all comments across all reviewers.
steps.common_mistake: Only reviewing comments from one reviewer — multiple agencies comment simultaneously

steps.detail: Every comment from every reviewing agency must be addressed. Use Bluebeam's markup reply feature to respond to each comment, or create a correction response letter referencing each comment by reviewer and sheet number.
steps.common_mistake: Missing comments from agencies that review later in the cycle (e.g., DPH, SFFD)

steps.step: Add revision clouds on ALL changed items
steps.detail: Every change between submission rounds must be enclosed in a revision cloud. Include revision delta markers (triangle with revision number). Revision clouds must be on the drawing layer, not as Bluebeam annotations.
steps.common_mistake: Submitting corrected sheets without revision clouds — reviewer cannot find what changed

steps.step: Upload only changed sheets for corrections
steps.detail: For plan check corrections, upload only the sheets that were modified — not the entire plan set. Use the same file naming convention with incremented revision number. Full set re-upload is only for addenda (new scope).
steps.common_mistake: Uploading the full plan set for a correction response — slows review and confuses version tracking

steps.step: Update sheet index and page count
steps.detail: If sheets were added or removed, update the cover sheet's table of contents and total page count to match the revised set.
steps.common_mistake: Cover sheet still shows original page count after adding sheets

steps.detail: After uploading corrected sheets, notify the reviewer through the Bluebeam Studio session or PermitSF portal. Do not assume reviewers are automatically notified of uploads.
steps.common_mistake: Uploading corrections but not notifying reviewer — plans sit in queue unreviewed

addenda_vs_corrections.correction: Response to plan check comments. Upload only changed sheets with revision clouds. Uses same application number and review session.
addenda_vs_corrections.addendum: Additional scope added to an approved or in-review permit. Requires new document upload with full addenda set. Format: [Number Prefix]-[Document type]-[Revision Number] [Street address]_[Type/Count of Addenda]. File size limit for site permit addenda is 350MB (vs 250MB standard).

document_type_numbering.naming_format: [Number Prefix]-[Document type]-[Revision Number] [Street address]_[Type/Count of Addenda]
document_type_numbering.note: If no application number yet, use street address. Revision numbers increment: R0, R1, R2, etc.

statuses.meaning: Plans meet all code requirements. No changes needed.
statuses.action: Proceed to fee payment and permit issuance.

statuses.meaning: Plans are approved with minor notations. Changes may be required to be shown on job-site set but do not require resubmittal.
statuses.action: Review all notations. Incorporate notes into construction documents. Proceed to fee payment.

statuses.meaning: Plans have deficiencies that must be corrected and resubmitted for another review round.
statuses.action: Follow correction response workflow (EPR-023 through EPR-028). Upload corrected sheets with revision clouds.

statuses.meaning: Plans have fundamental deficiencies. May require significant redesign.
statuses.action: Schedule pre-submittal meeting with plan checker. Address all comments. May need to restart review cycle.

multi_agency_review.overview: In-house review projects are reviewed by multiple agencies simultaneously in the same Bluebeam Studio session. Each agency adds their own color-coded markups.
coordination_tips: Review ALL agency comments — not just DBI Building
Agency comments may conflict — flag conflicting requirements to plan checker
Agencies review on different schedules — some comments may arrive later than others
Request a consolidated review meeting if comments from multiple agencies are contradictory

steps_after_approval: All reviewing agencies must show 'Approved' or 'Approved as Noted' status
Pay all permit fees via PermitSF portal
Verify contractor insurance and license (if applicable)
DBI issues permit electronically through PermitSF
Download approved stamped plans for job site
permit_issuance_process.note: Permit is not issued until ALL agencies approve and ALL fees are paid. One 'Corrections Required' from any agency holds up the entire permit.

decision_tree_integration.step_5_connection: EPR format requirements apply to ALL documents listed in decision tree Step 5
decision_tree_integration.otc_implications: Some OTC 'no plans' permits (Form 8) do not require plan drawings but still use electronic submission
decision_tree_integration.in_house_implications: In-house review plans must be EPR-formatted for multi-agency concurrent review in Bluebeam Studio
